TopicTitle: How much real time to the mun?

Articles.Content:
Hello,

I was thinking of flying to the mun in real time. How much time would this take? I\'ve been trying to search the forums for the answer but the search function does not want to be my friend today S:|

Thank you!
Possible in 7 if you go pretty much straight up. As Nova said, it depends on your approach.

Keep an eye on the timer on the upper left corner of the screen. It shows your elapsed mission time from the moment you launched, including time warps. You can tell how long in real time any missions takes.

Most of my munar missions in version 0.13._ took 6-7 hours of mission time to reach the Mun and land, though with persistence (and the Mun not always in the same place at every liftoff), it varies.

The shortest time to a Mun landing I ever had was about 5 hours and 20 minutes, when the Mun was lined up so that I had to go directly to trans-munar insertion late in my gravity turn (the mun rose while I was just getting to 70km up), rather than settle into a parking orbit first.

It took me a little over 6 hours RT (i warped, of course) to get to the Mun. about another 10 minutes to find a suitable landing spot.

Then i made something orbit Kerbin, went back to the lander to try and re-enter Kerbin, and the engine would not fire when I throttled up
I made transit from Kerbin Orbit to Munar orbit in 3.5 hours while in video production, playing KSP. It was the fastest I\'d ever done it and I\'m not even sure how it happened..
